subject: Law
title: Restorative Justice Philosophy
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Restorative Justice Philosophy.

hook.text: A thief meets his victim face-to-face. They talk. He apologizes. She forgives. That's restorative justice.

buildup.text: Restorative justice focuses on repairing harm rather than punishing offenders. It centers the victim's needs.

discovery.text: It uses facilitated dialogue between offenders, victims, and community members to find accountability and healing.

twist.text: Critics say it's too soft on criminals. But studies show lower recidivism rates compared to traditional punishment.

climax.text: South Africa's Truth and Reconciliation Commission used restorative principles to address apartheid's atrocities.

punchline.text: Punishment asks: what law broke? Restoration asks: who was harmed?
